snippet: President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia pressed pause on Wednesday in what had begun to look like an inevitable march toward war in Ukraine, but world leaders questioned whether it was a feint.
abstract: Russian Pres Vladimir V Putin, faced with rising violence in southeastern Ukraine, vows to draw troops back, but world leaders question his tactics based in part on his record in Crimea; Putin repeatedly denied that Russia's soldiers were involved in Crimea, only to admit later that they were.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Andrew Roth from Moscow; C. J. Chivers and Noah Sneider from Slovyansk, Ukraine; David M. Herszenhorn from Kiev, Ukraine; Steven Erlanger from London; and Alison Smale from Berlin.

lead_paragraph: President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia pressed pause on Wednesday in what had begun to look like an inevitable march toward war in Ukraine, but world leaders questioned whether it was a feint.

headline.main: Putin Announces Pullback From Ukraine Border
headline.print_headline: Putin Hits Pause in Ukraine Crisis Amid Skepticism
